page.title: 03Farming at Upper Bentley
page.content: The{farming}also involves 100{Dairy {cattle}which are friesans. The milking parlour for 16 head was built in 1983. It is highly automated and milking takes place twice daily, and each session takes 2 hours. The average daily yield 300,000 litres. Milk is collected by bulk tanker 9.30 a.m. Dairy cows calve every 9/10 months for between 4 and 7 years. Beef cattle are reared for the home market and for breeding in Europe A few{pigs}are kept in farrow and the piglets are sold when weaned. {Animals}graze in summer.The Dairy herd get extra concentrates,and the pigs have a mixed diet.In winter all animals are under cover. The dairy cattle are fed silage, potatoes, cereals, hay and concentrates. Sheep are fed silage and the breeding ewes are given supplements
